channel.title: Comments on: Building Models: Drone Intercept and Desmos
channel.description: iteration, making, building, and coding in education

item.title: By: Evan Weinberg
item.dc:creator: Evan Weinberg
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2017/06/04/building-models-drone-intercept-and-desmos/#comment-508">John Burk</a>.
Thanks John. I suppose you could see my inability to leave well-enough alone as a flaw, but it's always fun to think about new ways to approach old ideas.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to John Burk.

Thanks John. I suppose you could see my inability to leave well-enough alone as a flaw, but it’s always fun to think about new ways to approach old ideas.

item.title: By: John Burk
item.dc:creator: John Burk
item.description: Evan, I love how you have iterated this activity a few times to make it both more interesting and more approachable. It's a great reminder to any teacher of that there's always room for improvement, even in activities we think are already "good."
item.content:encoded:
Evan,
I love how you have iterated this activity a few times to make it both more interesting and more approachable. It’s a great reminder to any teacher of that there’s always room for improvement, even in activities we think are already “good.”
